  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* A table of all code fragments (main program and dynlinked modules) */

  20. #include "caml/codefrag.h"
  21. #include "caml/lf_skiplist.h"
  22. #include "caml/md5.h"
  23. #include "caml/memory.h"
  24. #include "caml/misc.h"
  25. #include <stdatomic.h>
  26. #include <stddef.h>
  27. #include <string.h>

  29. ‌struct code_fragment_garbage {
  30.   struct code_fragment *cf;
  31.   struct code_fragment_garbage *next;
  32. };

  34. ‌static struct code_fragment_garbage *_Atomic garbage_head = NULL;

  36. ‌static struct lf_skiplist code_fragments_by_pc;

  38. ‌static struct lf_skiplist code_fragments_by_num;

  40. ‌static int _Atomic code_fragments_counter = 1;

  42. ‌void caml_init_codefrag(void) {
  43.   caml_lf_skiplist_init(&code_fragments_by_pc);
  44.   caml_lf_skiplist_init(&code_fragments_by_num);
  45. }

  47. ‌int caml_register_code_fragment(char *start, char *end,
  48.                                 enum digest_status digest_kind,
  49.                                 unsigned char *opt_digest) {
  50.   struct code_fragment *cf = caml_stat_alloc(sizeof(struct code_fragment));

  52.   cf->code_start = start;
  53.   cf->code_end = end;
  54.   switch (digest_kind) {
  55.   case DIGEST_LATER:
  56.     break;
  57.   case DIGEST_NOW:
  58.     /* no one knows of this code fragment yet, no need to take its lock */
  59.     caml_md5_block(cf->digest, cf->code_start, cf->code_end - cf->code_start);
  60.     digest_kind = DIGEST_PROVIDED;
  61.     break;
  62.   case DIGEST_PROVIDED:
  63.     memcpy(cf->digest, opt_digest, 16);
  64.     break;
  65.   case DIGEST_IGNORE:
  66.     break;
  67.   }
  68.   cf->digest_status = digest_kind;
  69.   cf->fragnum = atomic_fetch_add_explicit
  70.                   (&code_fragments_counter, 1, memory_order_relaxed);
  71.   caml_plat_mutex_init(&cf->mutex);
  72.   caml_lf_skiplist_insert(&code_fragments_by_pc, (uintnat)start, (uintnat)cf);
  73.   caml_lf_skiplist_insert(&code_fragments_by_num, (uintnat)cf->fragnum,
  74.                           (uintnat)cf);
  75.   return cf->fragnum;
  76. }

  78. ‌static void caml_free_code_fragment(struct code_fragment *cf) {
  79.   caml_plat_mutex_free(&cf->mutex);
  80.   caml_stat_free(cf);
  81. }

  83. ‌void caml_remove_code_fragment(struct code_fragment *cf) {
  84.   struct code_fragment_garbage *cf_cell;

  86.   caml_lf_skiplist_remove(&code_fragments_by_pc, (uintnat)cf->code_start);

  88.   /* This is conditional on remove returning success because it's possible
  89.     for [caml_remove_code_fragment] to be called concurrently and we need
  90.     to ensure that only one code_fragment is put on to the garbage list */
  91.   if (caml_lf_skiplist_remove(&code_fragments_by_num, cf->fragnum)) {
  92.     cf_cell = (struct code_fragment_garbage *)caml_stat_alloc(
  93.         sizeof(struct code_fragment_garbage));

  95.     cf_cell->cf = cf;

  97.     do {
  98.       cf_cell->next = atomic_load_acquire(&garbage_head);
  99.     } while (!atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&garbage_head, &cf_cell->next,
  100.                                              cf_cell));
  101.   }
  102. }

  104. ‌struct code_fragment *caml_find_code_fragment_by_pc(char *pc) {
  105.   struct code_fragment *cf;
  106.   uintnat key, data;

  108.   if (caml_lf_skiplist_find_below(&code_fragments_by_pc, (uintnat)pc, &key,
  109.                                   &data)) {
  110.     cf = (struct code_fragment *)data;
  111.     CAMLassert(cf->code_start <= pc);
  112.     if (pc < cf->code_end)
  113.       return cf;
  114.   }
  115.   return NULL;
  116. }

  118. ‌struct code_fragment *caml_find_code_fragment_by_num(int fragnum) {
  119.   uintnat data;
  120.   if (caml_lf_skiplist_find(&code_fragments_by_num, fragnum, &data)) {
  121.     return (struct code_fragment *)data;
  122.   } else {
  123.     return NULL;
  124.   }
  125. }

  127. ‌unsigned char *caml_digest_of_code_fragment(struct code_fragment *cf) {
  128.   unsigned char *digest;

  130.   /* Note: this approach is a bit heavy-handed as we take a lock in
  131.      all cases. It would be possible to take a lock only in the
  132.      DIGEST_LATER case, which occurs at most once per fragment, by
  133.      using double-checked locking -- see #11791. */
  134.   caml_plat_lock(&cf->mutex);
  135.   {
  136.     if (cf->digest_status == DIGEST_IGNORE) {
  137.       digest = NULL;
  138.     } else if (cf->digest_status == DIGEST_LATER) {
  139.       caml_md5_block(cf->digest, cf->code_start, cf->code_end - cf->code_start);
  140.       cf->digest_status = DIGEST_PROVIDED;
  141.       digest = cf->digest;
  142.     } else {
  143.       digest = cf->digest;
  144.     }
  145.   }
  146.   caml_plat_unlock(&cf->mutex);

  148.   return digest;
  149. }

  151. struct code_fragment *
  152. ‌caml_find_code_fragment_by_digest(unsigned char digest[16]) {
  153.   FOREACH_LF_SKIPLIST_ELEMENT(e, &code_fragments_by_pc, {
  154.     struct code_fragment *cf = (struct code_fragment *)e->data;
  155.     unsigned char *d = caml_digest_of_code_fragment(cf);
  156.     if (d != NULL && memcmp(digest, d, 16) == 0)
  157.       return cf;
  158.   })
  159.   return NULL;
  160. }

  162. /* This is only ever called from a stw by one domain */
  163. ‌void caml_code_fragment_cleanup (void)
  164. {
  165.   struct code_fragment_garbage *curr;

  167.   caml_lf_skiplist_free_garbage(&code_fragments_by_pc);
  168.   caml_lf_skiplist_free_garbage(&code_fragments_by_num);

  170.   curr = atomic_load_acquire(&garbage_head);

  172.   while (curr != NULL) {
  173.     struct code_fragment_garbage *next = curr->next;

  175.     caml_free_code_fragment(curr->cf);
  176.     caml_stat_free(curr);

  178.     curr = next;
  179.   }

  181.   atomic_store_release(&garbage_head, NULL);
  182. }
